comments:
I have a helper POJO that is used in two JSPs.  I opened one JSP, selected the
method name and selected refactor->rename method.  I entered the method name and
hit preview.  The preview looked fine.  When I clicked ok, I got a
NullPointerException.

"An exception has been caught while processing the refactoring "Rename method
'getStatesDoneString' to 'getStatesDoneString2'"  Abort/Undo/Cancel.

Phil, I assigned 'p2' since this seems like an important "show off" case (as
well as for end users) so would at least like you to quickly investigate to see
if you can reproduce.

I haven't been able to reproduce yet.

I'm in a web project created from a wizard.
My class/JSP were created from scratch.

What's the stacktrace exception you're seeing (is it in the .log file or eaten up?)
Anything else special you can think of about your project?

Here is the stack trace.

Looks like this might be happening if the refactored method is in a called in  a
taglib directive element.

Is the method you refactored contained in the taglib directive somewhere?

Nitin I CCed you since you might have some insight on the TLDCMDocumentManager part.

No, in this case it is not being used within a tag directive.  I also logged
103396 and I am more confident now that that bug is most likely another symptom
of this bug.

In that bug I added a test case with some more detail.  I think it applies to
this bug as well.  The only thing is I can't reproduce the NullPointerException.

I hope that helps.

ok, since we can not reproduce, we'll resolve as "worksforme" ... but don't
hesitate to re-open if you find a reproducible scenerio on a recent build.

This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old is is assumed its dup, invalid, or worksforme resolution is no longer in qustion and the bugzilla needs no further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error in this case.
